intro: Raphanus chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese radish, is a root vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its crisp, white or pale yellow root, which is typically harvested when young for optimal flavor and texture. The plant grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately lobed leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. The plant is cultivated for its edible roots and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
